Build bridges and towers, and test them against train, boats, wind...

You are given a global budget for a world of 5 levels: if you are low on budget to complete a world, you'll have to modify previous levels to earn some extra bars and cables.

Don't hesitate to rate this game if you like it!

To create bars and build your structure, point an existing joint, then just drag from it and your bar will be created.

Your bridge has to resist to the passage of a train without breaking.

Joints aren't rigid, so you will have to create a proper structure to make your bridge rigid.

To zoom in or out, simply use the natural pinch gesture.

You can also use the "+" and "-" buttons on the bottom-right corner of the screen

This gesture also works in "play" mode.

To move the view and focus on different details of your structure, use your finger to drag the view in any direction.
Caution: with one finger, avoid touching structure elements to drag the view, or you will select them for editing by mistake.

Another way is to use two fingers (like the pinching gesture) to drag the view, allowing to touch structure elements without selecting them.

This gesture also works in "play" mode.
To move a joint, first select the \"move\" tool; then select and drag a node around. Its moves are limited by the maximum extents of its connected bars.
If you long-press a joint or a bar, a popup menu will appear to change its type, or even delete it.

You have a given bars budget in common for the 5 levels of a given world.\nIf you don\'t have enough bars to finish the last level, you\'ll have to modify the other levels (and stress-test them again to validate the modifications) to save some bars and complete the world.
Cables are another type of bars.\nThey are more traction-resistants, but are not compressable. They can also be a lot longer than other bar types.

In some levels, you'll see a red rectangle in the background to show the size of a boat.
The only way to make the bridge "boat-compliant" is to build a lift bridge. To achieve this goal you have access to new bar types: Jacks.

There are two types of jacks: ones expand, others contract. It's up to you to find how to combine them and create beautiful lift bridges.

One last thing: You'll have to modify the type of certain joints to "locking joints
"; these joints are necessary to break the bridge in several pieces, and to lock them back together after the boat passage.

You can use the \"undo\" button to dismiss the last edit action. A \"redo\" button is also available if you changed your mind and want to make the dismissed change again.\n\nThese two buttons keep several versions in memory, you can \"undo\" several successive changes if you want.

In "tower mode" the goal is not to build a bridge, but to build a tower of a minimum height.
The background shows the minimum altitude to reach to validate the level.

To be validated, a tower will be stress-tested with the wind and if it collapses before the end of the countdown, you fail.
